resp.text: Hello. We apologize we didn't meet your exspectations.   However our business is an event hall, if you were at a function, there more than likely it was hosted by someone that rented the facility. And,  how they host their event is totally up to them. Maybe it was noisy because it was a party, that's usually what happens. If you think  it was ghetto, maybe the event you chose to attend. Hopefully your experience will be different if you choose to visit us again. Have a great day. Lisa Colston -Omny

name: Michael Bass
text: ARAB, AL!! This is an amazing course. Tucked away in a secluded area off a major highway (231). The atmosphere of staff were great. Cart girls and workers were great. We took a group of 12 this year and played Friday, Saturday, and Sunday! ( 90 holes) We stayed at the lake house and enjoyed every second of the time here!

resp.text: Thanks so much for your kind review!  It was a pleasure hosting your group.  We hope you come back soon!

name: Melissa Cothran
text: What a beautiful course! Tree-line fairways, foothill views, a dam built over 100 years ago, a natural 40 ft waterfall . . . plus great golf!  The staff is friendly, and I recommend their great Southern gourmet burger.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review!  We know we'll see you soon!

name: Gary Dwyer
text: The course is a gem. It's in great condition and absolutely beautiful place to play. You will love it.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind review!  We hope you come back soon!

name: Chris Smiddy
text: Beautiful and amazing course!!!! Driving range could've been better since we had to hit off the mats only but there wasn't any rubber tees. There weren't any signs or pictures for the holes posted on the course. They wI'll give you a map upon request, so do so cause it's really detailed and amazing. Definitely look forward to playing again!!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review!  We hope you come back again soon!

name: Louis Tominack
text: Nice layout.  Greens are a bit slow.  Overall nice place to play.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review!  We hope you come back and play again soon!

name: Kevin Bacon
text: Nice "mountain" course! Pay attention to the book that they give you on insights to each hole!!  Greens in ok shape, t-boxes need to be cut and weeded...

resp.text: Thank you for your review!  We are currently working on many course improvements.  You probably saw that a number of trees were removed and new sod laid in their place.  We hope you come back again when our grounds crew has caught up on all the special projects and has the course in top shape.

name: Jamie Clark
text: Very fun and challenging course to play.  A course that everyone can play by choosing a set of tees that match your skill level.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review!  We hope you come back again soon!'

name: Dwight Washington
text: The course is in great shape. They changed the layout, what was the front is now the back. Greens were quick, fairways were plush. Give it a try, I think you will enjoy it.

resp.text: Thanks for your kind words.  We hope you come back soon!

name: Will Irby
text: Just in awful condition. The greens are awful, with dead spots and fungus issues. The bunkers are unplayable and full of rocks, the fairways are even in bad shape in several places. We paid $57 to play and it was a waste of money. For $25 I would play it, but it is at least 2x overpriced, if not a bit more. If you are in the area you are far better off going to an RTJ course or driving further to play a different course.

name: Marcia B
text: Love Love this gated golf community.  Like living at a resort with golf, fishing, pool, tennis and the the people are much more than neighbors.  They are friends of the truest sense.  The golf is outstanding and the many community activities are so much fun.  This area is a gem! Also great lodging at the lake house.

name: jay johnston
text: Could be and may have once been a nice course, but the greens were infested with cancer and the sand bunkers were just shy of being unplayable.  Bare lies in fairway and around the greens. This course needs a lot of maintenance before it will be worth $60/18 holes.

name: Andy Forrester
text: Great golf course. Greens are in great condition and the views are incredible.  Friendly staff, good value.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review!  We hope you come back soon!

name: Jeff Szarek
text:
This course came recommended by some people at work. We set up a tee time the day before for Saturday. We traveled about 40 mins to the course. It was right off the highway into a gated golf community. Right from the start we were greeted by the staff. Upon entering the clubhouse, I was amazed at the initial set up of the course. My co-worker had to rent some clubs, at which they were very accommodating by giving him a brand new set of Nike Vapors. I had the Coverts 2.0 from the previous year and was impressed at the rentals they provided. We went to the driving range and then the putting green and we were off. Long story short, the course was AWESOME and the view was even better. We found ourselves stopping to take pictures and taking in the view (Which I rarely do on course). What I thought was to be a 6 hr round (because of our relax play at each hole) was a little over 4 hrs. This course is in my TOP 5 best courses I've played in my life, (I've played in the range of 50-60 different courses). I would recommend this course to anyone who enjoys a challenge, but also a forgiving course layout. The scenic views are something out of a movie which as to the relaxation of the game of golf. If you are ever in the area, you have to check out this course.

A big Thank You to the staff there at Cherokee Ridge who were some of the top notch personnel a course can have. Jonathan Watts, a Graduate of the Golf Academy of America Orlando, did not disappoint to the customer service and knowledge one would find at that school.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review!  We hope you come back soon!

name: R C
text: The clubhouse has excellent food and the course views are breathtaking!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review!  We hope you come back soon!

name: Larry Bryan
text: The sand traps fill with water, almost no yardage markers, no idea where the holes are on the greens, some greens are in bad shape, and they allow groups of 7 to play. Nice layout but not worth the price.

name: Dick Bourget
text: Playing was wonderful

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review!  We hope you play again soon!

name: Screaming Weasel
text: Golf course is equally challenging and gorgeous. Top notch.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review!  We hope you come back soon!

name: brian jones
text: Several of the greens were bad, always considered this one of the best courses around but it isn’t anymore. Really disappointed.

name: JAMMIE LYNN
text: This course is way over priced for the condition it's in. I paid $61 to play on burnt greens on nearly every hole.  Edges of greens was really bad,  big sand holes you couldn't hit through.  Fairways wa in ok condition.  Most of all, they put out maybe 3 jugs, but only 1 jug had water in it, and that was on the 3rd hole.  We stayed thirsty!! We went  inside to buy a drink, well they had some water made up , but the water made up was also lukewarm.  This course maybe wasn't worth $18 much less $61. Will not be back.  Worst course played in many years of playing.

name: John Woodfin
text: Beautiful golf course and very good food at the clubhouse.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review!  We hope you come back soon!

text: Been to this café several times .   Servers are always very nice,  and the food is good.  Unfortunately, things tend to run a little slow, so I can't recommend this as a place to go if you  have less than an hour for lunch.

text: July 11th 2021 was the first time my family and friends attended Studio53 and it was beyond what we expected. The space was great the staff was right there to answer questions. The bathrooms are nicely decorated with a beautiful sitting room. My mom turned 70 so everything had to be perfect and Studio53 help make that happen! Check out the pics I posted ♥️

resp.text: Thank you so much! You are awesome. Can’t wait to have you back again.

name: mica naylor
text: I’m new here to Huntsville & I had the pleasure of being a vendor at a pop up shop here in May. I absolutely loved the environment! Ms. Tiffany was so sweet & helpful! I was prepared to get my makeup done in my car for the event but Ms. Tiffany set up a space for my makeup artist & I in the back. I was and still am so grateful. Did I mention the space in the venue? It’s PERFECT for literally any event. I will definitely be going back! I recommend this place to everyone who is looking for a venue 💞 keep going Ms. Tiffany! I am SO proud of you! May your light continue to shine bright & your business continue to flourish! 💞

resp.text:
Mica! Thank you for your awesome review of Studio 53. I’m so glad that you enjoyed yourself and we are looking forward to working with you very soon.
Your business is awesome! Once again, thank you!

text: If I could give zero stars I would.  As a potential customer I am very disappointed in this business. No professionalism or common courtesy. I set an appointment to meet with the owner. He was not only a no show, but when I texted I didn't get an answer and called. He was saying he was in the barber's chair and asked to give me a call the next day. The next two days I texted and called many times without a single response. My daughter told me to never call them again. Thankfully we found a professional black owned venue to host our special event.  This was an unbelievable experience to say the least. Do not waste your time with a owner that doesn't value it.

text: I saw Pink in concert here. The place was packed. Great seats for concert. Plenty of food concessions and drinks at reasonable price for a venue such as this. Parking and getting back to the interstate was a pain. They really need to work on this. The prepaid premier parking is right beside the building but not covered. Egress to main hwy took approximately one hour.

text: Very pretty course with great scenery. The greens here are some of the toughest greens I have ever experienced. If you are up for a challenge, this is a neat course to play.

text: We had my niece's baby shower at Cumberland today and it was super nice. The place has amazing views and Veronica runs the place top notch!

text: My first time there and I was impressed..Veronica is a very good manager...she is on top of the flow of players..

name: Brian Tolzman
text: Veronica was great!  The course was in rough shape. They did have bad weather however don't think that affected the conditions though.

resp.text: Not a correct assessment.  Condition and layout, one of the best in the area at this price point.

name: jullie hallman
text: Beautiful

name: Tangy Bodie
text: My husband and 3 others drive over 1 hr to play this course. When they got there a lady was working the club house. They informed her that they had reserved a tee time at 12:30. She was soooo nasty to them. She threw her hand up to cut them off and informed them that there were no carts available for 30-40 mins. The guys were ok with this since they would hit the driving range up in the meantime. It was her holier than thou attitude that made them mad. The owner was contacted and he defended her saying she sometimes comes off as rude, he did however go speak to the men and offered them a Gatorade as compensation... Yes will deff not be back! But they did say the course was nice.

resp.text: The real story of this review is that Tangy Bodie whatever her name may be, wasn't even at the golf course.   This is more of a story of how she can attempt to extract extreme compensation for the threat of a bad review.  From the moment speaking with Alexis on the phone the conversation quickly became "what kind of compensation will you give me??"  Meaning she wanted me to refund over $ 160.00 in greens fees because of her threats of a poor review.   I went out to the course and spoke to the gentlemen about the incident.  They were delayed only 5 minutes from their tee time.  My worker could have had a cooler head dealing with customers, but an apology was made and the men appeared to be happy that I looked into the situation. I offered to buy them a round of beers as a friendly gesture.   I am more than willing to accept a one star review than cower to a person trying to extort money in lieu of a bad review.   Cumberland Lake GC is one of the finest golf courses in Birmingham at its price point.  And, we also have some very fine individuals working behind the counter.  Please judge for yourself.

name: Mike Hamner
text: Really nice course, fairways and greens were very playable, challenging layout. Will definitely want to play it again.

name: Michael Dennis
text: Love it such a nice place to hang out and supper friendly  staff!!!

name: Jackie Aronhalt
text: My husband golfed 2 rounds here and loved it! I enjoyed the huge (amazingly clean) pool, food, drinks and view. Awesome!

name: Daniel Banks
text: Great little course. Played it while in Birmingham on business. Greens were a little slow, but rolled smooth. Fantastic layout. Will play again next time in town.

name: Amanda Gross
text: Having our daughter's wedding at Adams Acres was an absolutely amazing experience from day 1! The venue is beautiful inside and out and the staff went above and beyond to ensure that we were happy with every detail.

resp.text: It was so wonderful to get to know you all! Your daughter was a beautiful bride and the day turned out to be beautiful weather!

name: Craig Storey
text: A great place for a wedding.

resp.text: Thank you so much!

name: Stacey driver
text: My daughter, Summer and her husband Will were married at Adams Acres in February of 2020. They were one of the first few couples to ever be married there! This venue is the absolute best! It is located on private property in a secluded country setting away from high traffic areas giving you a serene and peaceful setting! The sunset pictures at Adam’s Acres are a must because I don’t think you can get a more picture perfect setting. The rustic decor and set up inside and out also make for the perfect background for pictures! The owners go ABOVE AND BEYOND to make your special day perfect!  From the first walk through to the final minutes of the wedding day (clean up time) Brittney Adams, her husband, and their wonderful tribe of helpers were the most gracious and supportive hosts! Brittney and I kept in constant contact from the very beginning! She gave me so much helpful information from how to set up the venue to the best priced insurance coverage to use! She made the stressful things that people don’t always think about when it comes to wedding planning extremely easy! The day of the wedding when we were still decorating, she and her her husband were there willing to move things around, hang things, decorate things, and even loaned us an industrial steamer for the bridesmaids who forgot to steam their dresses beforehand! From beginning to finish  Adams Acres made the entire experience an absolute beautiful memory for everyone involved! We can never thank them enough for making our youngest daughter’s wedding dreams come true!

resp.text: Their wedding was so stunning! Every detail was absolutely perfect! The best part was getting to know you guys! Y’all are so genuine and fun! We had a blast celebrating your daughter!

name: Erin BeidlemN
text: We recently used Adam’s Acres as the venue for our daughter’s rehearsal dinner, wedding and reception. Brittney and her husband are both so kind and accommodating! They were always available for questions and truly made this special time as stress free as it could be. They have really thought of everything! We have received countless compliments about the venue and recommend them whole heartedly!

name: Vanessa Rexford
text: We had our wedding at Adams Acres this past weekend. It was stunning and everything I had always dreamed of. The venue was gorgeous, and needed very few decorations to give a simple, elegant, rustic ambiance. Brittney and Anthony were so great to work with and were so accommodating when we had to postpone our wedding due to COVID in May. It's the most beautiful venue of its style in the area, and we couldn't have asked for better people to work with.

resp.text:
Thank you so much Vanessa! Your wedding was beautiful and one of our favorite moments was when your daughter joined in on your first dance! Your family was so much fun!
Thank you so much for choosing us! Best wishes to you and William!

name: Shea Wilson
text: As a wedding planner, there is nothing better than finding other vendors that you adore working with and let me say Adams Acres is one of them! From the first wedding I did there Brittany and Anthony have made me feel like family from the start! They go above and beyond for every single bride, family, & guest to step foot on their grounds! I always look forward to wedding days there knowing my brides have been given the best treatment possible!!

resp.text: Thank you Shea! We love working with you (The Grey House Events) as well! Your attention to detail and purposeful planning makes our brides’ days flow so smoothly and our days stress-free! When you are at our venue, we know every detail has been well thought-out and planned for! We always love working weddings with you! We look forward to seeing you again soon!

name: Britney Nelson
text: Working with the Adams family was an absolute joy! Brittany was always so quick to reply and answer any questions I had. I loved that what they had to offer was bundled all together and there was no added cost that blind sided you. I would highly recommend Adams Acres to everyone!!!

resp.text:
Thank you so much! We always try to be available because we know the wedding planning process can be overwhelming!
Thanks for trusting us through these uncertain times. The draping and decor at your wedding was amazing! We can’t wait to see the rest of your wedding photos!
Thanks again for booking with us!

name: Jennifer Gilman
text: It’s a beautiful property with many greats amenities. The owners have been very generous and accommodating with their time helping guide us through many event planning dilemmas. They are really easy to work with and we’re very happy with our venue choice. Totally recommend!

resp.text: Thank you Jennifer! Planning has difficult lately, but that’s why we are here to help!

name: Chelsea Keener
text: We LOVE Adams Acres! We are photographers and videographers who have worked along side the staff of Adams Acres. We were welcomed with open arms and always had our questions answered and needs met. The venue is rustic with shiplap which is totally our style. The venue is always clean and the ground well kept. Working with Brittney is so great and easy! I would definitely recommend this venue!

resp.text:
Thank you so much! We are always excited to see Chelsea & Joey Photography on our brides’ vendor list!
We love working with this creative duo! Amazing vendors make each wedding day a breeze!

name: Nazareth Thornton
text: This is the most amazing,  beautiful and professional venue that I have had any dealings with. The owner Brittney is so sweet and kind, she has been so helpful during this Covid-19  Pandemic,  when we couldn't have our planned Anniversary event,  she jumped right in and offered us another date, even into 2021 ,that really meant a lot to me. Every business has suffered during this time.When you have made plans and things happen beyond our control, we need more professional people like Brittney to keep us calm, and reassure clients that everything is going to be okay, and she has our backs. Thank you so much, I will I could give this venue 100 stars if I could. The customer service top notch. Book them, you can't go wrong. Mrs. Thornton

name: Timothy Gilley
text: Wonderfull place to have a wedding or any gathering

resp.text: Thanks Tim! We were so happy to celebrate with you & Amber!

name: Tammy Storey
text: Beautiful place to have a wedding.

resp.text: Thank you so much!

name: Katie Dukes
text: They went above and beyond the calling of venue owners! I couldn’t be happier with the way they made my day special! I highly recommend Adams Acres for your special occasion!!

resp.text: Thank you Katie! One of our favorite parts of your wedding was your father-daughter coordinated dance! It was so much fun. The love between you and Dylan was very evident and it was such a wonderful day!

name: Madison Ingram
text:
I would not recommend this venue if my life depended on it! Do not sign a contract with Adam’s Acres, and do not trust them. Adam’s Acres has been operating for less than a year. I was the first bride to book Adam’s Acres. I booked them when all that Brittany Adam’s had to show was studs and pictures of what it would look like when completed. I took a huge risk and trusted Brittany. Now, I regret that decision.

Due to the COVID shutdowns in March, I was forced to postpone my April wedding. All of the dates I had to choose from included holiday dates or August dates. We picked August 15th thinking that COVID would be over by then. However, COVID-19 cases are worse now than they were in April. After a lot of praying and talking to relatives, a month from our wedding, we made the decision to postpone our wedding again! This is not at all what we wanted to do, but for the safty of our family and friends we felt it was necessary. Brittany, being the heartless person she is, refused to give us another Friday-Saturday date in 2021. She offered a Sunday date with our rehearsal dinner being on a Thursday. That would not work for religious purposes and the fact that we have so many out of town guests.  She said “we would cut into her 2021 revenue if she gave us a Friday-Saturday date”. The only way we would be able to have a Friday-Saturday date is to pay the new 2021 rate of $3500.00 when we have already paid in full of $2500.00. Not only will she not let us postpone to a Friday- Saturday date in 2021, she refuses to give us a refund.

She has stolen our money and has taken advantage of the COVID-19 situation!! Do not book here!! Check out Magnolia Bay, Serendipity, Windmill Station, or The Grand!! Stay clear of Adam’s Acres and Brittany Adams!! Learn from my mistake!

resp.text:
We are so sorry that we were unable to find a compromise that worked for both parties after your cancellation. COVID-19 has been a nightmare for everyone and we understand your frustration.
When the State of Alabama shut down all businesses we rescheduled affected couples. It was heartbreaking for our couples and incredibly difficult for our small business that had been operating less than 6 months. We were so happy to have Fall dates still available, but we will be very honest...it has been difficult trying to recover from all the bookings we lost because of reschedules, especially when we didn't qualify for any assistance. We are thankful that unlike a lot of businesses we were able to survive and didn't have to close our doors.
When we rescheduled you to August 14th/15th, we held that date for you and turned away other couples and parties that contacted us for that date. Unfortunately when you cancel 3 weeks prior, it is impossible to re-book.
We have been open and safely hosting events again since May 30th. Every single couple has been dealing with the uncertainty of COVID and taking precautions to keep everyone safe. We offered to discuss these options with you as well. The mother of the bride tonight told us, "I know it wasn't as big as they planned, but they are finally married and we felt SAFE." Yesterday’s couple rented additional tables to put outside to further socially distance. All weddings have provided masks and had hand-sanitizer readily available. Tonight's bride also live-streamed her event so that her grandmother (who could not attend because of her assisted-living's COVID policies) could watch her get married. Vendors are wearing masks, caterers are hiring extra staff to safely serve everyone, our venue has extra staff at events for sanitizing... Everyone is making compromises and working hard to keep everyone safe.
We are in no way downplaying the seriousness of this virus. We also have no idea when it will end. We understood the reason for your cancellation and although it goes against our cancellation policy, we were empathetic and offered you a Sunday date in 2021 with no additional payments required. When you told us that interfered with your religion, we again offered for a Monday-Thursday. We are so sorry that none of those options worked for you.
Weddings are such an emotional time for everyone and we understand your disappointment. We know that all couples and wedding vendors alike have been thrown into incredibly difficult situations. When what you want to do for your couples conflicts with how you have to run your business--it feels impossible. If we let one person reschedule, we would have to do it for everyone to be fair. We are so sorry, but we simply cannot do that and keep our doors open. We have to follow our cancellation policy in this situation.

name: Jodie Kent
text: Gorgeous venue with professional, attentive staff. The owner Brittany is caring, professional and such a pleasure to work with.

resp.text: Thank you Jodie!

name: Sofia Harper
text: As a photographer I get to see the behind the scenes of venues and I can honestly say that I am so impressed with Brittany and how she treats her brides, their families, and the other services that cater to her clients from pre-booking to after the ceremony. During the covid crisis she she offered the bride I worked with several options to help her decide how to proceed and practical solutions to help with unusual circumstances. When the outer bands of a tropical depression blew in the weekend of the wedding; she was onsite to help fulfill the dream and workout the details of this outdoor wedding. It was a joy to work with Adams Acres and see what they were made of when the going was tough, they shined.

resp.text: Thank you Sofia! We are thankful for amazing vendors like you!

name: Yaak18
text:
Updated to include Class Action Lawsuit contact information!

My Daughter scheduled and paid for a wedding. Due to Covid shutdowns ordered by the Alabama Government,  the wedding could not be performed.  It wasn’t my daughter’s fault and it wasn’t Adams Acres fault.  In this case a reasonable person, in other words,  not a crook, would refund the deposit (full payment of $4000) to my daughter.  The owner, Crooked Brittney Adams,  refused to refund the money.  Her contract is iron clad to screw the customer no matter what happens.  She claims to be a Christian and puts off a wholesome,  caring demeanor but In my opinion she’s a scammer just like so many in today’s world.  Don’t trust her! Do not sign a contract with Brittney Adams and don’t give her any money.  She will steal it from you.

Update:  I have been contacted by other disappointed customers of Adams Acres and we are planning a Class Action Lawsuit against this fraudulent business.  If you have been victimized by Brittany Adams please send us an email at AdamsAcresClassActionLawSuit@gmail.com

We have a Dothan Law Firm ready to proceed.

Thank You.

resp.text: We are so thankful that out of the 9 brides affected by COVID at our venue, 8 have them have successfully been rescheduled. Two of those rescheduled weddings have already occurred at our venue since the restrictions were lifted. COVID has created such an unprecedented set of circumstances. While it hasn't been ideal for anyone, we have had open and honest communication throughout the process. Only 1 bride out of those 9 affected refused to communicate with us via phone and requested that communication be only between our attorneys. We honored her request. All brides affected were offered comparable Saturday dates and we even offered to extend those date options into 2021 if they still desired a Spring wedding. For those who were in school-- they were offered dates while school was not in session including dates during the Summer, Fall break dates, Winter break dates, and of course Spring 2021. We always try to work with our brides and their families and will continue to offer alternative dates for the 1 bride who has not yet rescheduled. We know that trying to plan a wedding during COVID has been very difficult and we are here to help with that process as much as we can.

name: wesley letourneau
text: Excellent service and staff

resp.text: Thank you so much! We strive to go above and beyond for every couple!

name: Cindy Lynn
text: Beautiful wedding I attended there!

resp.text: Thank you so much!

name: shari Arnold
text: Lovely venue. Sweet people.

resp.text: Thank you Shari!

name: Gayle Gilliland
text: It was really nice and spacious.

resp.text: Thank you!

name: todd mcgarvey

resp.text: Thank you, Todd!

text: Beautiful venue!!

resp.text: Thank you Hannah!

resp.text: Thank you so much!

name: John Long
text: Nice set up

resp.text: Thank you! Our brides do a phenomenal job decorating!

name: Abby Lee
text: Awesome venue!

name: Mira Polion
text: Beautiful venue! Great pricing!

name: Bobbie Allen
text: Very nice interior and ambiance. Lots of updates to the seating area and restrooms. A beautiful stage with mirrored backdrop really warms up the room filled with large circular banquette tables. The owners were very helpful and attentive to our needs. I would definitely consider renting it in the future.

name: Khadijah Kendricks
text: Really nice on the inside! Needs a make over outside though.

name: Beneva Nelson
text: I had a great time partying with these ladies and gentlemen. Live band was on point. DJ needed a little help but overall I had a great time. The facility is awesome. Tasteful decor,  adequate space, secure parking.

name: Sharon Chamblin
text: It was beautiful

name: Angelnetta Freeman
text: We had fun!! Everything was great!!

name: GG gg
text: We had a beautiful time a lovely place.

name: Archie Arrington
text: Great atmosphere. Loved the interior design of the space. Food was great, but needs a separate area for food prep and cooking.

name: J Moore
text: Nice center to have an event for all occasions.

name: Wanda Armstrong
text: Great price & beautiful settings for weddings, parties etc.

name: Amy Gardner
text: Very nice place

name: IBRAHIMA BARRY
text: Enjoyed many parties at this place.

name: Life With Bri
text: It was fun and nice

name: Clinton Hill
text: Great place

name: Alberta Smith
text: Nice very spacious

name: Aline Smith
text: It was great

name: Ella Forman
text: Good

name: Valarie Hatcher
text: Nice for parties

name: Tracy Tanniehill
text: Outstanding

name: Rodney Johnsey
text: Greens need to be mowed properly. To slow to take the breaks. Bring some bug spray.

name: Cody Watson
text: Beautiful layout but greens were slow.

name: Sarah Y.
text: Beautiful scenery and wonderful staff! Everyone is really nice and helpful and the course is very well laid out! Would recommend :)

name: Loucrita Batton
text: Beautiful, challenging, and had great time here.

name: hiep ma
text: It's great perfect condition

name: Mark Williams
text: Shape of the course was not good. The layout and area are amazing. It has so much potential. The greens are bent grass that is pretty much dead. I wanted to love this course but the greens made it hard.

name: Rusty Bennett
text: Great layout. Tees and fairways in great shape. Traps are in awful shape. Greens are in fair shape, but roll decent. Would play it again. Decent deal.

name: Dennis Knuth
text: Great layout, beautiful scenery... greens need some attention...staff was very professional and accommodating, breakfast was incredible....

name: Evan Agnew
text: Overpriced for the shape the course is in. $60 for an afternoon round is crazy. Several tee boxes didn't have grass and lots of dead areas on the green. Not a bad layout and fairways were in good shape.

name: J. Paul Wilson
text: This course was in great shape. Great layout!

name: Trace Palmer
text: Once they put some money into  it, it will be a 5 star course again.. It's a shadow of its once greatness. Greens have fungus,  bunkers full of grass, tall weeds in the uncut rough  but fairways are still in good shape..  it's an excellent layout but until new managment renews everything it only deserves 2 stars.

name: Chris Sakaguchi
text: Not as bad as some recent reviews indicated, but not what it once was. Greens are coming back and the poa has been treated. Give it a few more weeks and it should be better. Bunkers are atrocious but hey, not suppose to hit it there! A little more TLC and this course could be great again.

name: Randy Carroll
text: A great layout with a friendly staff. They don't appear to have enough financial support to take care of it.

name: Jsmajors@centurylink.net Majors
text: Good golf course not too long

name: Mark Priest
text: Course is an awful shape. Course is dry as a bone. Prices are outrageous. Greens are in bad shape. Sand traps are unplayable. There aren’t any 150 yard markets. The yardages on sprinklers and the concrete blocks on the tees do not tell you that those measurements are to the front of the green. Also, the course needs to use a colored tee system so that you can actually find the tees that you want to play. Overall, very disappointed that this course has gone way downhill in every way possible.

name: Steven Banks
text: Beautiful scenery and layout, but the worst golf course I've ever played. Nothing but weeds on the tees and fairways and they don't even mow them. Fairways were as tall as the rough. Greens had dead patches all over them. Paid $60 to play and it was probably worth about $15.

name: Payten Burns
text: Very Very nice

name: Mike Winchell
text: Beautiful golf course.  Nearly every hole is a photo op. Start hole one from the tips if you can. Great elevated view. They had a wedding on the tee box the night before we arrived due to the view. The course is not crowded so it is one of those secret gems you feel fortunate to find. Forgiving fairways. Great golf experience. I am looking forward to golfing there again. It was worth the drive.

name: Kerry Holeton
text:
Greens need some TLC
Rough area could be better kept
Bunkers need to be redone

name: Linda Raylene Sparks
text: Beautiful place and a fantastic course. Wonderful management and staff

name: Wayne Nall
text: Perfect views on every hole. The Greens are rolling great.most fun lay out course to play. Staff is the best. Highly recommended!!!! Don't pass it up.

name: Dustin Schwaiger
text: First time ever posting a review on google. This golf course is horrible. Fairways are nothing but weeds. Rough is nothing but weeds. It’s impossible to play the ball down out there. Bunkers have no sand on the lips. Some bunkers have grass growing in them. Some have liners showing. Greens have dead spots all over every green. Some tee boxes are nothing but weeds. Some have no grass. Members still act like the course is still in prime shape. Paid $25 to play there and still felt like I overpaid.

name: Josh Lawler
text: Turf was nice and soft, a little on the pricey side but is a must play for Blount County. Great course on a hot day, lots of shade and water coolers we're frequent (our trip was 93 degrees). We will return here through the heat of the summer.

name: Suzanne Butler (Where2Golf)
text: Nestling in a valley between two ridges of tree-covered hills, the up-market residential development of Limestone Springs can boast a championship golf course that is a delight from first to last. With unobtrusive villas skirting only a few holes, the course retains all the naturalness and tranquillity of this Appalachian foothills environment.

name: Chris Mahan
text: This is a beautiful place with upscale environment and friendly staff. They were incredibly busy, but made me feel like I was the most important person in the room. I don't play golf, but am seriously considering picking up the sport just to have an excuse to come back here on a regular basis.

name: J L
text: The overall experience was a bit of let down because I had heard so many good things about this course. I traveled more than an hour away as well as the friends I invited and was pretty embarrassed by the conditions of the greens. I could see how this place would be beautiful if it was well maintained but every green had some sort of sun damage or grass issues. The temporary greens were not even cut so it was as if you were putting in the rough. The water coolers had no ice and we never once saw a cart asking if we wanted anything. Im writing an honest review so that others won't have the same bad experience that I did. I hope they fix things because the overall scenery is beautiful

name: James Banken
text: Good golf course. Friendly, after talking to locals, it had not been maintained like in the past. I would return tho.  I went in October and if you play there, bring gnat spray.

name: T Garrett Neill
text: Mixed feelings.  At one time, one of the top courses in the state, and certainly my favorite.  Played today for the first time in a while, and although the course is nice, it is NOT the experience and condition that it once was.  It appears that they are working hard, but the edges are a bit rough.  Greens good, but slow.  Carts have been allowed to go almost anywhere.  It's a bit like the local good ol' boys have taken over.  I played behind 4 groups of 5 apiece, playing their own ball.  Took about 4:40 to play 18 as a single.  No chance of playing through or an offer to.  Should not have 5somes.  Staff was nice, decent food.  Fortunately,  I came on a Monday for a $50 rate.  If it was weekend it would have been $90!  Tough to justify driving an hour from Hoover.  I will play here again, but not motivated to try again quickly.

name: Gary Chevalier
text: One of my fav's, bunkers were sketchy the last time l played there. People are great and course layout is great.

name: Jan Mooney
text: Very pleasant. Food was very good

name: Matt Clickner
text: Stayed in the cabins here for a golf weekend, great accommodations and easy access to the course. Course felt like it would have fit in with the Robert Trent Jones courses, well kept and nice layout.

name: Will Denton
text:
This review hurts me to write because this course used to be one of my favorites in the Birmingham area.  But that is just simply not the case anymore for this course. $70  +cart  on a Tuesday is a totally rip off. The greens on October 24 where so bad and the fairways had been cut but the clippings left in the fairway.

For this price point go to farm links or any of the Trent Jones trails.

Sad how far this course had fallen

name: Greg Keller
text: In great shape!!

name: Ryan M (RDM41)
text: Great neighborhood with an awesome course. Highly recommend.

name: Walla Hatchee
text: "Limestone Springs has also been consistently rated 4 ½ stars by Golf Digest’s Places to Play, ranked in the top five public golf courses in Alabama by GolfWeek, and named to America’s Top Golf Courses by Zagat Survey"

name: Terry Roll
text: Great golf course

name: Zachary “Z Money” Cardwell
text: This is hands down one of if not the best golf course in the entire state of Alabama.

name: Paula ksm
text: Great golf course

name: catherine myers
text: Beautiful venue!!

name: Jeff Morris
text: Very nice

text: Legit. But also legit in the middle of nowhere. No cell service.

name: JR H
text: A lovely, roomy old mansion that is ideal for receptions and parties. It is owned by some longtime friends of ours. They live on the premises. They can offer many options. Has a good amount of on-site parking.

name: Ruby Tadlock
text: Was there years ago. Lovely place

name: MzAwesome
text: Went to a ball here really nice place

name: William McHenry
text: Wonderful place and evening

name: Courtney Seals
text: nice and open

name: Korey Crawford
text: Me and my wife was married at new creation and also had our reception there, from the time you open the door till you leave you will be in ahhh, if it's not the beautiful chandeliers or beautiful sounding music or service that gives you know complaint with a fully functional kitchen and bar, the staff made our experience rememberable.

name: Jessica Clark
text: First let me tell you how Mr. Maddox saved the day for my dad's Birthday Party the DJ we hired equipment wasn't working and before we could ask Mr. Maddox jump in and saved the day and started you using his own music ( that we didn't pay for) to get the party started. So, words can not express how thankful my sisters and I are that we used New Creations Special Event Center. Also Mrs. Maddox is a doll and a great bartender as well. We will be using New Creations Special Event Center from now on and you should too! Tell him Jessica Clark sent you!

name: jada denise
text: My Granddad had hi 60th Birthday party there on 11/7/20 and it was awesome we really enjoyed our selves and Mr. Maddox made sure that everything was in order.

name: Juanita Scott Rivers
text: Beautiful establishment. Clean and well kelpt. Me and the husband attended a 60th bday bash. Very Brautiful. Drinks was nice. Will rent

name: Clifford Kennon
text: New Creations Special Event Room is a great place to have your next function or event.  The floor plan is spacious and the bar and staging area are both first class.  The staff shows great hospitality and concern for your event.  They handle all the details for you in a very responsible way! I highly recommend them for parties, weddings, receptions, meetings and get-togethers!

name: mindy davis
text: Wow is all I can say about  this place. Top notch from the head, down to the facility! The owner seemed genuinely concerned about everyone enjoying themselves. Not one bad experience in many visits. Definitely worth a booking. Don't hesitate to book this place now!! Thank you Mr. Maddox for showing my family and I a great time for every occasion.

name: Mya Alston
text: I had my graduation party here not too long ago and it was amazing! Mr. Maddox made sure that I had everything I need and my family and guests were comfortable so I’m grateful for that. It was an overall pleasant experience and I can’t wait to have my second grad party at New Creations in the next 4 years!!😊

name: Rakyah Smith
text: A friend of mines just had an event at this place that I attended and I must say I had a great experience! The building was beautiful and clean and the staff was very nice as well! I will definitely be having my baby shower there.

name: Mike Cook
text:
This is a top notch facility in the city of Birmingham!!
Very professional, clean , well organized place to host Any event and have that wow factor atmosphere!!!  My family has had numerous events here and we are planning my mom 60th birthday party this year. Please stop by for yourself

name: Terrence King
text: Very clean and modern event center. Less than 3 minutes from the freeway. Conveniently located 5 minutes from downtown.

name: michele coleman
text: The event center is a beautiful place, plenty of parking and spacious. The owner and staff are wonderful and very friendly. They treat you like family!! This is perfect place to hold any special event!!!

name: Victoria Greene
text: I recently had an event at New Creations Special Event Room, my event turned out fabulous.  The place was very clean and smell nice.  The owner was very gracious, helpful and accommodating.  My decorator was a little late and he physically helped us decorate and my event started on time.  I especially like the part that at the end of my event we were able to just leave. The owner and his team did all the cleaning.  I definitely recommend the use of this facility!!!

name: Sylvia Grady
text:
I attended a 60th birthday party this weekend. This place is beautiful and very clean! The owner and staff was very professional,  kind, helpful and friendly.
I will highly recommend this place to others.

name: Yureka Johnson
text: 5 Stars! Just attended a wedding anniversary party here. I really enjoyed it. The place was beautiful and the owner and staff were great!

name: Betty Malone
text: Attended a number of events held at the center.  Very clean and inviting building.  The owners and staff were on location to assistant in any way possible.  Would recommend the event center of all your special occasions.

name: Valneiceiar Gardner
text:
Re: Amanda 50th Birthday Party May 25, 2019
Professionalisms and good customer service plays a vital role in the success, or failure of a client based business. The celebrations of life should be a joyous occasion, therefore a client especially if the paying has specified their expectations and has entrusted the business to facilitate such a monumental and personal achievement. A venue is only as good as its staff ,and most importantly, it’s ownership . A nice venue is only a building if there is No Clientele. Mr. Maddox, remember that “The FISH ROTS from the Head” Down.

name: Alicia “Li Li” Hutchins
text: This event center is very nice and easy for your guests to locate. The owner and his staff were very helpful and friendly to my party guests. Also the price for everything is very reasonable.

name: jamillah smith
text: I attended an event at New Creations and loved it. I loved  building and it was so clean. The owners was very nice.  I will have my  event there.

name: jamillah smith
text: I attended an event at New Creations and loved it. I loved  building and it was so clean. The owners was very nice.  I will have my  event there.

name: Gail Maddox
text: Awesome we had a blast

name: Sherman Smith
text: New Creations is a very beautiful place , I recommend it. I give it 🌟 🌟 🌟 🌟 🌟

name: Oven Mitt Gang
text: Owner is rude. Cheated me out of my time. Then after dispute about time, which was only five extra minutes because he interrupted a performance, he called the police instead of dissolving the situation over five extra minutes. Along with drawing a firearm. Do not give him business. He seems as if he is a nice person then once he has your money he turns snake. He guarded over my entire event sat at the door a good portion on my rented time. Don’t give your money

name: Irene Roper
text:
RE: Amanda 50th Birthday Party May 25,2019

PLEASE DO NOT RENT THIS PLACE !!!
Thanks for asking why? The OWNER was terrible, extremely rude,
controlling, argumentative, standing over you, rearranging chairs and
tables. Bottom line just in the damn way.
NOW LETS TALK ABOUT THE DJ
He was giving a list of songs to play "BUT" decided to play what he wanted to play. 90% of the songs he played were cut short very
very unprofessional.
NOW LET ME HELP YOU MR. MADDOX
You have a nice venue but if you are that insecure, you need to rewrite your contract to cover your insecurities . So you can stay out the way, when clients are trying to decorate. PLEASE if you are going to hang
out you need to follow the dress code.

name: Sonja Anthony
text: I had my son's Trunk Party at this location in June. The facility was very clean and beautiful. The owner was nice,polite and conducted himself in a professional manner. Throughout the event the owner made sure that I was satisfied and everything was going well. I will definitely used this facility for any future events and will highly recommend to others.

name: Michelle Wright
text: We had a blast at New Creations Special Event Room. My wedding reception turned out great! Owner and staff were very helpful.

name: Jacqueline Thompson
text: The owner of this business was very helpful at my event, my guess enjoyed themselves and I was very pleased with the DJ playing all my songs on my playlist. I enjoyed and will be coming back, thanks for your business.

name: Nate Hope
text: Two thumbs up!! I recently attended a birthday party at this establishment and I was extremely impressed. Everything was on point - very clean building, nice lighting, awesome system and DJ, and very professional owner. Thanks for a wonderful evening. Can't wait until the next event at New Creations....

name: kajbass
text: When I say the Best Place to have any kind of Event, Family Reunion, Class Reunion or gathering this is the Place....

name: Amanda Gardner
text:
I had a 50th Birthday Celebration and the owner was very rude to my family that was there to set up for the celebration. I am very disappointed in the owner and the DJ. Will not recommend this establishment to any one not even enemy.

I had a dress code and the owner did not even respect that. The DJ had a man with him that was drunk and hitting on all the females.

name: toni mathews
text: OK LET'S TALK ABOUT A FIRST CLASS EXPERIENCE FROM THE VENUE TO THE STAFF & OWNER. I HAD A BIRTHDAY PARTY ON CHRISTMAS EVE ALL MY NEEDS WERE MET. I COULDN'T ASK FOR A BETTER DAY THE VENUE WAS SPOTLESS, THE RESTROOM WERE SPOTLESS . LET ME REMIND YOU THIS PARTY AGAIN WAS ON CHRISTMAS EVE YOU WOULD THINK THAT THE OWNER AND HIS STAFF WOULD HAVE RAN OUT OF STEAM ON THIS DAY.  THEY COULD'VE BEEN WITH THEIR FAMILY AS MOST PEOPLE ARE ON THIS DAY, BUT THEIR KINDNESS AND PROFESSIONALISM NEVER STOP OR WAIVER. MY GUEST OR STILL RAVING OVER THE EXPERIENCE HERE, AND SO AM I. I WOULDN'T CHANGE A THING, AND IF I POSSIBLE I WOULD DO IT ALL OVER AGAIN NEXT YEAR. I'VE GOT TO BOOK THE DATE BEFORE SOMEONE ELSE BEAT ME TO IT....  SIGN SUPERFANTASTIC & SATISFIED BIRTHDAY GIRL!!!!!!!!!!!!

name: Robert Upshaw
text:
I had my wedding and wedding reception at New Creations Special Event Room.The service was outstanding. The owner treated my family and I like we were royalty. The people working during the event were nice to us. They kept the building clean during our event and they cleaned up the building after the event. We didn't have to do anything.
They have a big screen on the wall that shows the dance floor. They also have surround sound in the building. It was awesome! My family and I have already paid our deposit to have our family reunion there in July 2016.
Thank you New Creations Special Event Room. I give you 10 stars!

name: Thomas Vonn
text: I was a little skeptical at first but when I entered this place, I was blown away. It is gorgeous! I had my wedding here last weekend and everything was outstanding!

name: Kiara Smith
text: The staff and the owner was very polite. The building is very beautiful, I highly recommend this event center. I would give this a 10 star rating  if I could.

name: philbert andrews
text: I had a band banquet the new creations and it was truly a great experience. The staff was very nice and friendly, and all of the children had a blast. the facility is very well kept. I would recommend new creations to any body having a party or a banquet

name: Harrinda Smith
text: Very since Event Center. Beautiful and Great music.

name: Christina Lucas
text: I just had my 50th birthday party at New Creations Special Event Room. I really enjoyed! This place was awesome and the owner was very professional. I am planning to have my mother’s 75th birthday party here in May.

name: Tye D
text: The atmosphere is great and enjoy every minute.

name: Kendra Johnson
text: What a superhub hospitality. I highly recommend it! I rented the New Creations Special Event and the owners was most gracious and kind. Again I highly recommend it!

name: Robert Walker
text: A geeat place to host any event. Plenty of parking, gracious host and decor that will impress anyone.

name: Delvecchio Alston
text: Just attended a birthday party. It was very nice! I particularly enjoyed the dance floor with the big screen.

name: Arisha Bolden
text: Very nice facility along with professional staff.

name: anton brandy
text: The place is beautiful and the staff was very helpful and courteous

name: comingsoon 2U
text: Please  do not  rent from these  owners!! They have very nasty attitudes!! Form the security all the way to the dj, they all have attitudes. As the day of my event  to set up,Please the owner he watch us the whole time as if we were kids . And he walks around  with his nose in the air as if he is  better than you. And in the closing  in our event  he throws  away people  food  and drinks  that's wasn't open!! No I will not recommend  this place  to no one

name: Laura Manson
text: Attended a birthday party here and the venue is clean and looks amazing.

name: Erica Hines
text:
Great Venue for any event! Owners very
friendly and very "Hands On." Thank you Mr. and Mrs. Maddox for a great experience!!!!

name: Myke Ellis
text: While the establishment is wonderful, the owner was terrible. He not polite and even argued with guests very controlling over the appliances: refrigerator, ice machine,  rearranging chairs, opening/closing blinds etc.. definitely not a people person and should not be over a business in which he interacts with people. Should not be supported nor endorsed.

name: Latoya Logan
text: I heard wonderful things about this business.... Planning on having my reception here once I look inside... comments???

name: Val R
text: Management is terrible!! The man over the establishment was extremely rude and selfish. Went out of his way to take paper cups away from children and pour their beverages down the sink and even threw the cups in the trash because the cups were his not theirs and "[he] could waste his cups if he wanted to" extremely unprofessional.

name: HBE_Clips
text: Awesome

name: Ebony Catlin
text: I had a blasts of a time everything was so nice......

name: Sterling Slaughter
text: Nice place.

name: Jeffery Hall
text: Had a nice time

name: Eubanks Quarters Farms
text: Micah is awesome . great value

name: Ginny Phillips Allen
text: Both new and used pianos, variety of sizes and wood finishes, even exotic. Private lessons available, as well as concert rentals.

name: Sandra Jemison
text: Very nice and spacious venue! Very Clean! I had my 50th b'day party here in 2017! It was a hit. The owners are very nice people and easy to work with.

name: Matthew Stevens
text: It is not 4.6 stars! It's a solid 5!! Friendly owners, nice equipment!

name: Tiffany
text: Bella Luna is an excellent place to hold events..It has a bar and kitchen area...IT'S WHEELCHAIR ACCESSIBLE and it's very clean ..

name: Shirley Russell
text: Fun times with family and friends.

name: Eddie Lumpkin
text: Love it so nice and clean

resp.text: Thank you!! You’ve made our day!

name: Michael Mask
text: Great people and wonderful atmosphere to work out

name: Zandie Murphy
text: Can't wait intell to have my wedding there

resp.text: We are excited too :)

name: Tammy Welch
text: I went to my cousins 50th Birthday extravaganza in my home town Alabama at Bella Luna we had a Fabulous time. This place was really nice to have a party!!

name: Lori Gordon
text: Very nice place

name: Aimee Pope-Headen
text: This is a great place to have a party. The atmosphere is very nice and elegant.

name: Dean Drake
text: This is a good place for parties and banquets a little  pricey.

name: omg raider
text: Nice place to have an event

name: Virgil Motes
text: Great atmosphere to work out and get a tan great owners clean as well!!!!

name: Evoris Thomas
text: Great place to plan  social gatherings

name: Connie Hickson
text: Was there for an appreciation ceremony. Nice place.

name: Jarvis Kelly
text: Great Place

name: Kristie Cook
text: Great for parties, wedding, receptions, any formal type event.

name: Taberah German
text: Great frrod and a good price

name: Angela Scott
text: Great place to work out.

name: Todd Koone
text: 24/7 Gym, great little fitness facility.

name: Robert Carroll
text: Beautiful place.   Amazing staff.

name: Chelsea Stagner
text: I called for a week to get a tanning membership and i finally talk to someone.  Next day he tells me he wont be there.... no ones ever there... how do you run your bussiness this way...prices are way to high..... oh well .

name: Jeremy Houser
text: Great atmosphere

name: Anita Jackson
text: Love it and will be back

name: Brittanie Smith
text: Very nice place

name: Cheryl Williams
text: Great place!

text: Beautiful hall

name: William Scott
text: A you rent for events

name: Cheryl Williams
text: Great place!

name: Brittanie Smith
text: Very nice place

name: Christine Wilson
text: Camp McDowell is absolutely beautiful.  The facilities were immaculate and perfect for our family.

name: Tim Talley
text: Super awesome had a great time with family and friends. Has a lot to offer!

name: Charles Bernhard
text: Great place to eat while at Camp McDowell for choir camp. Food was ready on time and very good for camp fare. Love Camp McDowell😃

name: Melissa Barton
text: Love camp McDowell.  Fifer Hall is a great meeting place with a full kitchen

name: Randy Box
text: Very nice camp. A little paradise in the wilderness.

name: Michael Barton
text: It is a good venue if you need to feed a crowd

name: Kevin Brane
text: Char 32 is great for food and now open for lunch.

name: Margaret Bemis Sharp
text: The facility is nice, but the parking wasn't great. I think the event I attended was too large for the venue.

name: Chuck Turner
text: Great food

name: KELDRICK JONES
text: Nice and fun
